preqs: One of FIT1047 or FIT1031 or equivalent and one of FIT1045, FIT1048 or FIT1051 or equivalent introductory programming

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1031, FIT1047} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1045, FIT1048, FIT1051} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

description: This unit will provide students with knowledge of cyber security issues, and their relevance to the management of information systems in contemporary organisations. Students will learn about common cyber attacks and the techniques for identifying, detecting, and defending against cyber-security threats. Further students will have an understanding of the ethical and privacy issues relating to the security of information systems. Additionally students will be required to analyse and assess recent developments and future trends in cyber security technologies.
